name: You have applied for a conditional order  (JOINT  - FIRST IN TIME APPLICANT)
body:
Case number: ((reference number))

Dear ((first name)) ((last name)),

You have applied for a ‘conditional order’. A conditional order is a document that says the court does not see any reason why you cannot ((isDivorce??get a divorce))((isDissolution??end your civil partnership)).

Your ((partner)) also has to apply. This is because you are doing a joint application. You will receive a notification when they have applied. 

If they do not apply by ((partnerDidNotApply due date)) then you will receive a notification telling you what you can do to progress the application. 

If you do not think they will ever apply for the conditional order, then you can contact the court using the phone number at the bottom of this email. Your application will be changed to a sole application, where you will become the main applicant and your ((wifeDidNotApply??wife))((husbandDidNotApply??husband))((civilPartnerDidNotApply??civil partner))((partnerDidNotApply?? will become the respondent.))

You can track your((isDivorce?? divorce)) application any time from this link: ((signin url))

Divorce and Dissolution
HM Courts & Tribunals Service
divorcecase@justice.gov.uk
0300 303 0642 (Monday to Friday, 8am to 6pm)

Your feedback helps improve this service for others: https://www.smartsurvey.co.uk/s/Divorce_Feedback/?pageurl=/email
